definition[0]: to have an important effect or influence on something, especially by taking something away from it
example[0]: Video is making huge inroads into attendance figures at movie theaters  (=taking away its customers).
example[1]: They have made significant inroads into the European market.
example[2]: The administrative workload is making massive inroads into our working day  (=taking away time).
definition[1]: to make some progress towards achieving something difficult
example[3]: We havenâ€™t made much of an inroad into the backlog of work.
